intro: Sida garckeana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes. Sida garckeana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
